statements: UPDATE swimmer_feedback SET coach_evaluation = 'Great job!' WHERE swimmer_id = 1;
UPDATE swimmer_feedback SET rating = 9.5, judge_evaluation = 'Outstanding performance' WHERE swimmer_id = 2;
UPDATE swimmer_feedback SET coach_evaluation='Great job!', rating=4.5 WHERE swimmer_id=1;
UPDATE swimmer_feedback SET rating=3.8, judge_evaluation='Needs improvement' WHERE id=5;
UPDATE SwimmerFeedback SET Feedback = 'Good job!' WHERE SwimmerID = 1 AND CoachID = 2;
UPDATE PerformanceEvaluation SET Rating = 4, Comments = 'Well done' WHERE EvaluationID = 10 AND SwimmerID = 3 AND JudgeID = 5;
UPDATE SwimmerFeedback SET Feedback = 'Great job on improving your stroke technique' WHERE SwimmerID = 101 AND CoachID = 201
UPDATE PerformanceEvaluation SET Rating = 9, Comments = 'Impressed with the overall performance' WHERE SwimmerID = 102 AND JudgeID = 301
UPDATE Swimmers SET age = 25, coach_feedback = 'Good progress' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Judges SET overall_evaluation = 'Excellent performance' WHERE name = 'Alice';
UPDATE Swimmers SET age = 25, coach_feedback = 'Excellent feedback from coach' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Coaches SET specialization = 'Swimming Techniques', experience_years = 10 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE Swimmers SET swimmer_age = 25 WHERE swimmer_id = 1;
UPDATE Coaches SET coach_specialty = 'Diving' WHERE coach_id = 3;
UPDATE Swimmers SET swimmer_age = 25, swimmer_name = 'Alice' WHERE swimmer_id = 1;
UPDATE Evaluations SET score = 95, feedback = 'Great job!' WHERE evaluation_id = 3;
UPDATE Swimmers SET age = 25, level = 'Intermediate' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Coaches SET specialty = 'Diving' WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE Swimmers SET level = 'Intermediate' WHERE id = 1
UPDATE Coaches SET specialty = 'Nutrition' WHERE experience_years > 5
